Why not just use the default threaded view of email. Simple, clear to see and the thread is all together. Although I would recommend the traditional table view of the mail list pane over the new table view as it somehow manages to flatten the threads into some sort of flat thing that is exceedingly difficult to in the user interface.

content:
If the accounts are POP, the transition is simple. Just copy the entire profile with these steps: Here is the link for moving a profile in Windows when installed in default location: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there

If the account is IMAP and closed, you should first COPY (not move) all messages in the CLOSED acccount to Local Folders and then do the above steps.
creator: davidsk

content:
Bonjour, pour résoudre ton problème on aura besoin de. quantité de copies d'écran. Si tu arrives à démarrer/ouvrir Thunderbird va au menu Aide > Informations de dépannage > Dossier de profil > Ouvrir le dossier .... ensuite ferme TB. Maintenant tu devrais voir ce qu'on appelle le dossier de profil avec un comme xxxxxxxx.default-release (ou similaire). Dans la hiérarchie des dossiers du gestionnaire de fichiers de Windows monte au niveau au-dessus en affichant le contenu du dossier "Profiles" : fais une copie d'écran de son contenu. Monte encore d'un niveau dans la hiérarchie des dossiers pour voir le contenu du dossier "Thunderbird". Dans ce dossier tu devrais voir un fichier "profiles.ini" Ouvre ce fichier dans un éditeur de texte et fais-en une copie d'écran....

Question complémentaire: quand tu démarres TB que vois-tu dans la fenêtre qui s'affiche? Est-ce que TB te demande de configurer une adresse émail existante?
creator: Mapenzi

content: I don't know why you would need a prompt! TB closed, remove your actual Thunderbird folder which is located in Roaming ... users\username\AppData\Roaming\ then copy the entire folder Thunderbird from \AppData\Roaming\ in your backup and paste it in your actual "Roaming" folder. Restart and everything should be there.... but I think there is still some confusion on your side
creator: Mapenzi

content: You are likely referring to my guidelines. The MUST was included as a reminder, as some people incorrectly were pasting to the appdata\roaming\thunderbird folder. Following my suggested steps, that was because installing and starting thunderbird causes the profile to be created. the transition was to overlay that completely and those who followed the process were successful. You can verify that by installing and closing thunderbird and then browsing the appdata\roaming folder, where you will see a thunderbird folder. A possibility of not seeing that folder occurs when the user installs thunderbird from microsoft, as that release uses a different location for the profile.
creator: davidsk

content: Hello, should be this bug https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1990571 The problem can be resumed by a downgrade to v142 https://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/thunderbird/releases/142.0/ In your actual installation go to Settings > General > Updates and disable automatic updates. After download and install v142 start by launching Thunderbird through the command line with the --allow-downgrade parameter https://mzl.la/3zLzilx
creator: Mapenzi
